page.title: 04Employment in Scremerston.
page.content: A number of years ago most of the employment in Scremerston was local, both{farming}and{mining,}but today many men travel to Berwick-upon-Tweed to work.Some travel even further to Edinburgh and the Torness{Power {Station}in Scotland. Many married women work both full and part-time in Berwick-upon-Tweed. Most of them are{shop assistants, {shorthand typists}or{hairdressers. There is no actual employment in Scremerston and that is the reason why most of the people both young and old travel out of the village to work. Many retired people live in the village and these are housed in the sheltered housing at Armstrong Court and in bungalows or Council houses. The farms in the survey area are worked by only one or two men as most of the farming is mechanised today.
